ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would summarise the class as being both a survey and an intense seminar in analysis of recent and current Middle Eastern hotspots. Through close and in-depth analysis of a variety of thinkers, both religious and political, Dr Shaker challenges all her students to be able to reach a more nuanced and actionable understanding of how to resolve some of the problems (like Sunni-Shia relations) that affect the Middle East today.
I would highly recommend it if you wanted to learn about a variety of conflicts and become equipped with the tools to understand them.

It is a great overview of the most pertinent conflicts facing the Middle East today and also touches upon past historical events that have produced lasting conseqeuences/engagements. Surveys US involvement in these conflicts and a few of the seminar meetings are transformed into UN Conflict Resolution simulations where students take on a role and argue to solve a conflict.

Yes! Professor Shaker is great! She presents a lot of facts in the class discussions about the literature and it is a great introduction to the Middle East and all the conflicts in it - as long as you go in to the class without biased opinions.

I would extremely recommend it--it is extremely educational for both those who come into it with extensive and only surface knowledge on the region. A great approach and great professor. Extremely inspiring and educational.
If you have the chance to take it, do it.
Highly recommend it! Great content and exciting seminars.
This was a great course with so many good topics covered. Unfortunately it will not be taught again as Dr. Shaker is now teaching at Claremont!
